column4: Lucien Barriere Grand Prix de Deauville (Group 2) (3yo+) (Round Course) (Turf)
column19: Three-year-old New Ground is feared but this looks a solid chance for SUNWAY
column20: 5/2 Marquisat, 9/4 New Ground, 4/1 Sunway, 5/1 Sibayan, 8/1 Uther, 12/1 Casapueblo
column36: Career best last time over 1m6f, but has solid form at this trip; gives at least 2lb away
column37: Smart for Jean-Claude Rouget last year but stepped it up a level this season for new trainer, and gained a career best 48 days ago over 1m6f at Longchamp; drop in trip shouldn't be a huge issue considering what he did before that over 1m4f, so makes appeal for all that he gives at least 2lb away to all his rivals; has won on officially good to soft ground through to heavy.

column4: Lucien Barriere Grand Prix de Deauville (Group 2) (3yo+) (Round Course) (Turf)
column19: Three-year-old New Ground is feared but this looks a solid chance for SUNWAY
column20: 5/2 Marquisat, 9/4 New Ground, 4/1 Sunway, 5/1 Sibayan, 8/1 Uther, 12/1 Casapueblo
column36: Hasn't won since his 2yo campaign but new trip could unlock more
column37: Has a consistent enough profile at up to 1m2.5f, and matched his turf career best last time when second in a Group 3 at Vichy, beaten only half a length into second; no wins since 2yo campaign though, so will want this new trip to produce a bit more improvement in order to add to his tally; good to soft going to heavy are all ground he's run well on.

column4: Lucien Barriere Grand Prix de Deauville (Group 2) (3yo+) (Round Course) (Turf)
column19: Three-year-old New Ground is feared but this looks a solid chance for SUNWAY
column20: 5/2 Marquisat, 9/4 New Ground, 4/1 Sunway, 5/1 Sibayan, 8/1 Uther, 12/1 Casapueblo
column36: Won well off a long break last time and entitled to be straighter for that
column37: Bit like stablemate Casapueblo, he won early in his career but then went a while without adding to three wins but regularly ran well  in good company, including Group 1s; returned from a 244-day break to gain his fourth success, landing a C&D Group 3 (good to soft) three weeks ago, when Uther was fourth, and progression from that would make him a leading player.

column4: Lucien Barriere Grand Prix de Deauville (Group 2) (3yo+) (Round Course) (Turf)
column19: Three-year-old New Ground is feared but this looks a solid chance for SUNWAY
column20: 5/2 Marquisat, 9/4 New Ground, 4/1 Sunway, 5/1 Sibayan, 8/1 Uther, 12/1 Casapueblo
column32: Guy Pariente Holding & Qatar Racing Ltd
column36: Ran well over 2m last time but drop to 1m4.5f no issue; big run would be no surprise
column37: Group 1 winner as a 2yo who produced some good efforts at the top level at three, but had been held earlier this year before better form in blinkers, including a fair first attempt as a stayer last time in the Goodwood Cup; drop back in trip won't be an issue and seems to handle ground from good to very soft, so big run would be no surprise; Christophe Soumillon on for first time since the St Leger.

column4: Lucien Barriere Grand Prix de Deauville (Group 2) (3yo+) (Round Course) (Turf)
column19: Three-year-old New Ground is feared but this looks a solid chance for SUNWAY
column20: 5/2 Marquisat, 9/4 New Ground, 4/1 Sunway, 5/1 Sibayan, 8/1 Uther, 12/1 Casapueblo
column36: His fourth in the Derby as a 50-1 is good form but needs to learn to settle
column37: Has a achieved most of the two 3yos in the field, his fourth as a 50-1 shot in the Derby particularly sticking out, and didn't help his chance when last seen in the Grand Prix de Paris by racing keenly, but still finished a place ahead of Uther; takes on his elders for the first time and more than good enough to win this, but if he doesn't settle again, he'll prove vulnerable; seems to handle most ground.

column4: Lucien Barriere Grand Prix de Deauville (Group 2) (3yo+) (Round Course) (Turf)
column19: Three-year-old New Ground is feared but this looks a solid chance for SUNWAY
column20: 5/2 Marquisat, 9/4 New Ground, 4/1 Sunway, 5/1 Sibayan, 8/1 Uther, 12/1 Casapueblo
column36: Behind a couple of these on his last two starts, so more need to beat them
column37: Related to plenty of classy types, most notably Sosie, and run well plenty of times this year, including a Group 3 success (1m2f110yds, good to soft) at Longchamp in April; seems sure to run his race but was behind New Ground two starts back and Marquisat last time, so a bit to find with that pair; another in this who appears to go on different ground.

column19: The one with the most upside remaining is MY CLOUD so he gets the nod in yet another competitive event. Devil's Point is interesting
column20: 3/1 My Cloud, 5/1 Volterra, 7/1 Vertbois,  Cicero's Gift, 9/1 Tito Mo Cen, 10/1 Dark Trooper,  No Lunch,  Dreamliner, 12/1 Devil's Point, 14/1 Contentious Soul, 20/1 Tumbler, 25/1 Apax
column36: Beat this year's Sussex Stakes winner Qirat last October over 7f; returns from a break
column37: Likes to lead or race prominently, and notably beat this year's Sussex Stakes winner Qirat in a handicap at Ascot last October over 7f on soft going; just below his best on his seasonal return in a Group 3 at Haydock at the end of May, so a slight concern he's not been seen since, but stays this trip, seems to go on most ground and might be able to control the sectionals.

column19: The one with the most upside remaining is MY CLOUD so he gets the nod in yet another competitive event. Devil's Point is interesting
column20: 3/1 My Cloud, 5/1 Volterra, 7/1 Vertbois,  Cicero's Gift, 9/1 Tito Mo Cen, 10/1 Dark Trooper,  No Lunch,  Dreamliner, 12/1 Devil's Point, 14/1 Contentious Soul, 20/1 Tumbler, 25/1 Apax
column36: Has a smart level of ability but hasn't won a Listed race yet or Group event
column37: Been showing a smart level of ability all year but that has been mostly in conditions events, with the only exception a third in a valuable handicap over C&D last time on good ground behind Contentious Soul; should run his race and stays a mile fine but vulnerable in this grade.

column19: The one with the most upside remaining is MY CLOUD so he gets the nod in yet another competitive event. Devil's Point is interesting
column20: 3/1 My Cloud, 5/1 Volterra, 7/1 Vertbois,  Cicero's Gift, 9/1 Tito Mo Cen, 10/1 Dark Trooper,  No Lunch,  Dreamliner, 12/1 Devil's Point, 14/1 Contentious Soul, 20/1 Tumbler, 25/1 Apax
column36: Capable of top-level form but hasn't been seen for 419 days; comes with risks
column37: Had lots of top form as a 2yo, including a second in a mile heavy-ground Group 1, and he started off last year in good style, notably making all to land the German 2000 Guineas; not seen since a disappointing effort in the Prix Jean Prat, so difficult to know what to expect here, for all that the booking of Christophe Soumillon catches the eye.

column19: The one with the most upside remaining is MY CLOUD so he gets the nod in yet another competitive event. Devil's Point is interesting
column20: 3/1 My Cloud, 5/1 Volterra, 7/1 Vertbois,  Cicero's Gift, 9/1 Tito Mo Cen, 10/1 Dark Trooper,  No Lunch,  Dreamliner, 12/1 Devil's Point, 14/1 Contentious Soul, 20/1 Tumbler, 25/1 Apax
column36: Won C&D handicaps on last two starts; this a big step up but he is in form
column37: Never run in a Group race before but comes into this in tremendous form having won two C&D handicaps, one on soft ground the other on good; this is clearly a step up but being in form means a big effort could be forthcoming.

column19: The one with the most upside remaining is MY CLOUD so he gets the nod in yet another competitive event. Devil's Point is interesting
column20: 3/1 My Cloud, 5/1 Volterra, 7/1 Vertbois,  Cicero's Gift, 9/1 Tito Mo Cen, 10/1 Dark Trooper,  No Lunch,  Dreamliner, 12/1 Devil's Point, 14/1 Contentious Soul, 20/1 Tumbler, 25/1 Apax
column36: Has posted two career bests this year but last two runs not at that level; needs upturn
column37: Posted a pair of career bests this season, the peak one in a mile Group 2 at Saint-Cloud, but hasn't been to that level the last two times he's been seen, so needs an upturn in form to gain a fifth success of his career; won on heavy but his other three wins came on the AW.

column19: The one with the most upside remaining is MY CLOUD so he gets the nod in yet another competitive event. Devil's Point is interesting
column20: 3/1 My Cloud, 5/1 Volterra, 7/1 Vertbois,  Cicero's Gift, 9/1 Tito Mo Cen, 10/1 Dark Trooper,  No Lunch,  Dreamliner, 12/1 Devil's Point, 14/1 Contentious Soul, 20/1 Tumbler, 25/1 Apax
column36: Remains with plenty of ability; Billy Loughnane, who has won on him, back in the saddle
column37: Started career in great style, once beating Docklands in an AW novice event, but became a bit in and out as a 4yo; done better with consistency this campaign and wasn't far off his best when second in a mile Listed event 34 days ago, which seemed to suggest he can handle good ground, albeit he looks better on softer; Billy Loughnane, who has won on him, back in the saddle today.

column19: The one with the most upside remaining is MY CLOUD so he gets the nod in yet another competitive event. Devil's Point is interesting
column20: 3/1 My Cloud, 5/1 Volterra, 7/1 Vertbois,  Cicero's Gift, 9/1 Tito Mo Cen, 10/1 Dark Trooper,  No Lunch,  Dreamliner, 12/1 Devil's Point, 14/1 Contentious Soul, 20/1 Tumbler, 25/1 Apax
column32: Scea Haras Des Forets, Regis Clarot Et Al
column36: Had some solid form at the start of this year but not seen since May; questions to answer
column37: Enjoyed a good start to 2025, and matched his career best in the Group 3 Prix Edmond Blanc (1m, very soft) in March, before being a bit below that level in the Group 2 Prix du Muguet, when behind Vertbois; slightly worrying he's not been seen for 121 days, but in the mix if returning at his peak.

column19: The one with the most upside remaining is MY CLOUD so he gets the nod in yet another competitive event. Devil's Point is interesting
column20: 3/1 My Cloud, 5/1 Volterra, 7/1 Vertbois,  Cicero's Gift, 9/1 Tito Mo Cen, 10/1 Dark Trooper,  No Lunch,  Dreamliner, 12/1 Devil's Point, 14/1 Contentious Soul, 20/1 Tumbler, 25/1 Apax
column36: Well bred colt who is very much on the up; sound claims with progression likely
column37: Well bred colt, who is building a solid profile himself, and was last seen seeing off 29 rivals in the Royal Hunt Cup (1m, good to firm), with the second that day coming out and winning a valuable handicap since; looks more than ready for this step up but did miss the Group 2 Summer Mile in July due to a bad scope; leading claims and has a Group 1 entry.

column19: The one with the most upside remaining is MY CLOUD so he gets the nod in yet another competitive event. Devil's Point is interesting
column20: 3/1 My Cloud, 5/1 Volterra, 7/1 Vertbois,  Cicero's Gift, 9/1 Tito Mo Cen, 10/1 Dark Trooper,  No Lunch,  Dreamliner, 12/1 Devil's Point, 14/1 Contentious Soul, 20/1 Tumbler, 25/1 Apax
column36: Only ever raced over a mile once, and that was last time; place chances at least
column37: Done the majority of his racing over 6f or 7f, often running to a smart level, and his first ever run at a mile a month and a half ago resulted in a nose second in Listed company at Vichy; less exposed than some at the trip and can be involved in the mix for places at least.

column19: The one with the most upside remaining is MY CLOUD so he gets the nod in yet another competitive event. Devil's Point is interesting
column20: 3/1 My Cloud, 5/1 Volterra, 7/1 Vertbois,  Cicero's Gift, 9/1 Tito Mo Cen, 10/1 Dark Trooper,  No Lunch,  Dreamliner, 12/1 Devil's Point, 14/1 Contentious Soul, 20/1 Tumbler, 25/1 Apax
column36: Was in good form earlier in the year but not been seen for a while
column37: Didn't race as a 2yo and proved more than capable in first season, winning a maiden and running with credit at a higher level, but fared even better in the early part of this year, although that did come on and AW surface; last two starts, back on grass were not so good though, including when behind Vertbois and Tumbler Prix du Muguet, and hasn't been seen since; has won fresh but others make more appeal.

column19: The one with the most upside remaining is MY CLOUD so he gets the nod in yet another competitive event. Devil's Point is interesting
column20: 3/1 My Cloud, 5/1 Volterra, 7/1 Vertbois,  Cicero's Gift, 9/1 Tito Mo Cen, 10/1 Dark Trooper,  No Lunch,  Dreamliner, 12/1 Devil's Point, 14/1 Contentious Soul, 20/1 Tumbler, 25/1 Apax
column36: Needs to step up again but is in form and remains capable of better
column37: Won his maiden by 10l last year and run well on plenty of occasions since, although he didn't need to be at his best a couple of months ago when landing a mile Listed event at Chantilly on good to soft, a second success in a row; this represents another step up but he does get some weight for age, and isn't dismissed.

column19: The one with the most upside remaining is MY CLOUD so he gets the nod in yet another competitive event. Devil's Point is interesting
column20: 3/1 My Cloud, 5/1 Volterra, 7/1 Vertbois,  Cicero's Gift, 9/1 Tito Mo Cen, 10/1 Dark Trooper,  No Lunch,  Dreamliner, 12/1 Devil's Point, 14/1 Contentious Soul, 20/1 Tumbler, 25/1 Apax
column36: Nicely bred sort who has been running well; still has more to offer
column37: Ran to a decent level earlier in the year, winning a 1m1f AW Listed event on his second start before a fair fourth in a 1m2.5f Group 3 on good to soft; given a three month break and has returned in fine heart, building on his Vichy run with a fourth in a C&D Group 3 here recently on good; takes on his elders for the first time and remains with upside.

column19: It'll be no surprise to see Balmoral Lady bounce back after a break, but CACOFONIX can be tough to beat. Daylight a player to
column20: 7/4 Cacofonix, 9/4 Daylight, 3/1 Balmoral Lady, 6/1 Rosy Affair, 25/1 Lesslepasser, 33/1 Ten Horns,  Megarry
column32: Ecurie Gribomont, Ecurie Du Sud & G Augustin-Normand
column36: Hasn't won a Listed race let alone a Group contest, so needs career best
column37: Smart sort and ran creditably in a C&D Group 3 (soft) in July but generally struggled to make an impact at that sort of level, with four of his wins coming in conditions events and the other in a handicap; bit to find with some if they perform to their best and trainer has stronger claims with Daylight.

column19: It'll be no surprise to see Balmoral Lady bounce back after a break, but CACOFONIX can be tough to beat. Daylight a player to
column20: 7/4 Cacofonix, 9/4 Daylight, 3/1 Balmoral Lady, 6/1 Rosy Affair, 25/1 Lesslepasser, 33/1 Ten Horns,  Megarry
column36: Comfortably held in a Listed event 20 days ago; this looks a tough task
column37: Won a couple of times as a 2yo in Ireland but only one win since joining this trainer, that was as a 14-1 chance when landing a 7f handicap at Longchamp on good to soft in June; sent off 34-1 when sixth of 11 in a 5f Listed event here just under three weeks ago, so looks to have a tough task in this company.

column19: It'll be no surprise to see Balmoral Lady bounce back after a break, but CACOFONIX can be tough to beat. Daylight a player to
column20: 7/4 Cacofonix, 9/4 Daylight, 3/1 Balmoral Lady, 6/1 Rosy Affair, 25/1 Lesslepasser, 33/1 Ten Horns,  Megarry
column36: Capable of good form but not always consistent; needs to rediscover best
column37: Finished second as a 45-1 chance in a 5f Group 3 at Chantilly in June and has contested lots of classy races across his career, but was behind McGarry 20 days ago in a 5f Listed event here, so needs to rediscover his best in order to place at least.

column19: It'll be no surprise to see Balmoral Lady bounce back after a break, but CACOFONIX can be tough to beat. Daylight a player to
column20: 7/4 Cacofonix, 9/4 Daylight, 3/1 Balmoral Lady, 6/1 Rosy Affair, 25/1 Lesslepasser, 33/1 Ten Horns,  Megarry
column36: In great form prior to last run; sound claims if bouncing back
column37: Not at her best over 5f 56 days ago but was in great heart prior to that, beating subsequent July Cup winner No Half Measures (getting 5lb) in the Achilles Stakes (5f, good) before being beaten 3.5l in the Group 1 King Charles III Stakes; not yet won over 6f but has to be of interest on the majority of 2025 form, with Christophe Soumillon a noteworthy jockey booking; acts on any ground.

column19: It'll be no surprise to see Balmoral Lady bounce back after a break, but CACOFONIX can be tough to beat. Daylight a player to
column20: 7/4 Cacofonix, 9/4 Daylight, 3/1 Balmoral Lady, 6/1 Rosy Affair, 25/1 Lesslepasser, 33/1 Ten Horns,  Megarry
column36: Needs more on the figures but difficult to rule out while in form
column37: Mostly progressive and consistent filly, who ran with credit in a couple of Listed events over 5f before winning one over 6f at Pontefract; likes fast ground but has run nicely on soft, suggesting she'd handle anything; difficult to rule out with a profile like hers for all that she needs extra on the figures.

column19: It'll be no surprise to see Balmoral Lady bounce back after a break, but CACOFONIX can be tough to beat. Daylight a player to
column20: 7/4 Cacofonix, 9/4 Daylight, 3/1 Balmoral Lady, 6/1 Rosy Affair, 25/1 Lesslepasser, 33/1 Ten Horns,  Megarry
column36: Recent efforts suggest he should be involved in the finish; closely matched with Daylight
column37: Improving colt, especially this season, and went from winning a conditions event in May (7f, good to soft) to going close in a solid running of the Group 1 Prix Jean Prat (7f, soft), when Daylight was just behind, to beating that same filly by a short-head over C&D 20 days ago on his first try over 6f since his debut; clearly not much between that pair but has obvious claims.

column19: It'll be no surprise to see Balmoral Lady bounce back after a break, but CACOFONIX can be tough to beat. Daylight a player to
column20: 7/4 Cacofonix, 9/4 Daylight, 3/1 Balmoral Lady, 6/1 Rosy Affair, 25/1 Lesslepasser, 33/1 Ten Horns,  Megarry
column27: Ecurie Haras Du Cadran & P Van Belle
column36: Has lots of classy form and closely matched with Cacofonix; one of the more likely types
column37: Showed top-class form as a 2yo, including placing in two 6f Group 1s, but a plan to make her a miler earlier in the year didn't quite come off; been one place and not far behind Cacofonix on last two runs, so should be finishing where he does; one of the more likely types.

column19: Haggas 3yo Crown Of Oaks is a strong contender but this is a race packed with in-form candidates, such as GLISTENING NIGHTS.
column20: 11/10 Crown Of Oaks, 5/1 Desert Shadow, 8/1 Financer, 12/1 Titian,  Glistening Nights,  Spioradalta, 14/1 Time Tells All, 16/1 Dawn Of Liberation,  Distinction, 25/1 Precious Spartan
column32: S Bulmer, P Hebdon & R Taylor
column36: Runner-up at York (to Titian) in June and at Windsor in a Racing League event 16 days ago
column37: Three wins over 1m2f on good/good to firm last season; showed best form of current campaign when runner-up at York (to Titian) in June and Windsor (Racing League) 16 days ago, which make him look a big player.

column19: Haggas 3yo Crown Of Oaks is a strong contender but this is a race packed with in-form candidates, such as GLISTENING NIGHTS.
column20: 11/10 Crown Of Oaks, 5/1 Desert Shadow, 8/1 Financer, 12/1 Titian,  Glistening Nights,  Spioradalta, 14/1 Time Tells All, 16/1 Dawn Of Liberation,  Distinction, 25/1 Precious Spartan
column36: Won at York (1m2f, good) in June and creditable fourth at Haydock three weeks ago
column37: Held up when winning a 17-runner amateur riders' race at York (1m2f, good) in June and creditable fourth at Haydock three weeks ago; respected on that and he may prove suited by this stiff finish.

column19: Haggas 3yo Crown Of Oaks is a strong contender but this is a race packed with in-form candidates, such as GLISTENING NIGHTS.
column20: 11/10 Crown Of Oaks, 5/1 Desert Shadow, 8/1 Financer, 12/1 Titian,  Glistening Nights,  Spioradalta, 14/1 Time Tells All, 16/1 Dawn Of Liberation,  Distinction, 25/1 Precious Spartan
column36: Running well before latest outing, when making the running (three ran) was maybe not ideal
column37: Had a 1m2f win in May (his only run here) and two in June; three good placings before a lesser show in three-runner race on latest outing, but making the running may have been against him that day; not far away if he bounces straight back.

column19: Haggas 3yo Crown Of Oaks is a strong contender but this is a race packed with in-form candidates, such as GLISTENING NIGHTS.
column20: 11/10 Crown Of Oaks, 5/1 Desert Shadow, 8/1 Financer, 12/1 Titian,  Glistening Nights,  Spioradalta, 14/1 Time Tells All, 16/1 Dawn Of Liberation,  Distinction, 25/1 Precious Spartan
column36: Gelded before his tidy win on handicap debut at Ayr (1m2f); up 6lb but capable of better
column37: Finished third on first three starts, on last two occasions turned over at 8-11 and 1-3; subsequently gelded and he was evens when upped to 1m2f for handicap debut at Ayr (good) on latest outing, produced between horses over 1f out for a tidy win; up 6lb but should still be capable of better.

column19: Haggas 3yo Crown Of Oaks is a strong contender but this is a race packed with in-form candidates, such as GLISTENING NIGHTS.
column20: 11/10 Crown Of Oaks, 5/1 Desert Shadow, 8/1 Financer, 12/1 Titian,  Glistening Nights,  Spioradalta, 14/1 Time Tells All, 16/1 Dawn Of Liberation,  Distinction, 25/1 Precious Spartan
column36: Four wins last year (one over C&D) and back in the groove on his latest two outings
column37: Had four wins last year (one over C&D) and got back in the groove on his latest two outings this term, winning by 4l at Chester and short-headed at Ayr; another bold show looks likely.

column19: Haggas 3yo Crown Of Oaks is a strong contender but this is a race packed with in-form candidates, such as GLISTENING NIGHTS.
column20: 11/10 Crown Of Oaks, 5/1 Desert Shadow, 8/1 Financer, 12/1 Titian,  Glistening Nights,  Spioradalta, 14/1 Time Tells All, 16/1 Dawn Of Liberation,  Distinction, 25/1 Precious Spartan
column36: Looks best on good ground or softer; two 1m2f wins at Ripon in a very solid campaign
column37: Tends to race freely; looks best on good ground or softer, including for one 1m2f win at Ripon in May and another on latest outing; made all in the latter; very reliable this season.

column19: Haggas 3yo Crown Of Oaks is a strong contender but this is a race packed with in-form candidates, such as GLISTENING NIGHTS.
column20: 11/10 Crown Of Oaks, 5/1 Desert Shadow, 8/1 Financer, 12/1 Titian,  Glistening Nights,  Spioradalta, 14/1 Time Tells All, 16/1 Dawn Of Liberation,  Distinction, 25/1 Precious Spartan
column36: 0-6; gelded before improved form when second of seven at Sandown (1m2f on good) latest
column37: Well beaten on handicap debut in June but, having been gelded, showed improved form when second of seven at Sandown (again 1m2f on good) eight weeks later; travelled best in the latter and needs to see the race out a bit better if he's to make this his first win.

column19: Haggas 3yo Crown Of Oaks is a strong contender but this is a race packed with in-form candidates, such as GLISTENING NIGHTS.

column36: C&D wins on good to firm in July/August; close third six days ago on his only other visit

column19: Haggas 3yo Crown Of Oaks is a strong contender but this is a race packed with in-form candidates, such as GLISTENING NIGHTS.

column36: Three wins this summer and has a great record here; unraced on firmer than good since 2021

column36: Doing well over 1m for new yard but has more to prove over 1m2f
column37: Won three of his five starts for this yard, the wins all at Ripon; those races were over 1m, however, and his form was not so good when he tried 1m2f twice this spring for his former yard.

column37: Posted a personal best when winning this race in 2023 and hit a new high when taking the Group 2 Temple Stakes at Haydock the following spring, but winless since and mostly disappointing this year; takes a big drop in class after failing to threaten in the Nunthorpe last week but hard to know what sort of form he's in.

column36: High-class, dependable and the one to beat on form; wears blinkers for the first time
column37: Has made into a high-class, dependable sprinter and he wasn't beaten far in the King Charles III Stakes at Royal Ascot (5f, good to firm) in June; far from disgraced in another Group 1 at Deauville last time when the extended 6f possibly stretched his stamina; all his wins have come on good ground or firmer so rain could jeopardise his chance, but he's the one to beat on form in first-time blinkers.

column37: Often makes the frame and did so again when a never-nearer fourth in Listed race at Newmarket (6f, good to firm) last Friday; at least as effective at 5f; should give his running but others appeal more for the win.

column37: Equally effective at 5f and 6f and has given her running on every start this year, fifth in Group 3 at York on latest; has a bit to find with one or two of these but she may not have reached her ceiling just yet and she will not be inconvenienced if the rain arrives.

column37: Tough 5f handicapper who goes well here and arrives in top form, but she faces a very stiff task on these terms and would be a surprise winner.

column37: Still a maiden after 13 starts but scores high marks for consistency, and he ran well on stable debut when third of nine in handicap at Thirsk (7f, good to firm) two weeks ago; he'd have been closer with a clear run too and commands plenty of respect against less experienced rivals.

column37: Well-bred colt who changed hands for just 3,000gns earlier this year; went off 40-1 on debut at Leicester (7f, good) last month, keeping on well after slow start to finish fourth of 12; open to plenty of improvement.

column37: Unraced here; tailed off lame in the 2023 Northumberland Plate on final start for Keith Dalgleish (same owners); has plenty of stamina in the pedigree and stuck on from last to a respectable sixth in nine-runner handicap at Goodwood (2m, soft) on return this June; dropped 2lb and should be able to build on that run with improved fitness levels today.

column37: Never better on Flat than when winning over C&D (soft) in June, coming from the rear with the first two finishing 6l clear; 4lb higher today but that was followed by a hurdling career best, when winning a good prize on good ground six weeks ago, so he's on a roll.

column37: Unraced here; last won in March 2023; down the weights, significant ability remains and stable among the winners, but other runners are preferred.

column36: Has run creditably in three of her five starts this term, second at Carlisle 18 days ago
column37: First visit here; 2m win at Haydock off a 1lb higher mark last August; has run creditably in three of her five starts this term, including when second at Carlisle 18 days ago, so has an each-way chance.

column37: Fourth in the Grade 1 juvenile hurdle at Aintree is flanked by three hurdling wins, best form taking a strong handicap later in April on latest; 0-7 on the Flat (unraced here) but had some handicap form last year to be taken seriously; needs a close look.

column36: Reliable in 2024; dropped 2lb after a forgivable reappearance and needs a second look
column37: Unraced here; reliable in Flat handicaps in 2024 and did well over hurdles until a heavy defeat in February; off 153 days before 11th of 12 at York (16-1) five weeks ago but went as if he needed the run and was beaten only just over 6l; dropped 2lb and needs a second look.

column37: Unraced here; has won once on Flat and over hurdles but pretty disappointing overall and makes limited appeal on most performances; off since May; first run since changing hands and leaving the O'Neills.

column37: Eighth of nine last September on his only run at this track; May win was over 1m4f but he's run with credit over 2m on two of his last three starts, so enters the each-way calculations.

column19: Cavern Club looks sure to go well again but GOOD SHOW, It's All About You and Give It To Me Oj are interesting opponents.

column36: Three 3rds from five Chester races; three wins in 2025 but lots more to prove beyond 1m6f
column37: Three thirds from five races at Chester; long losing run before he scored twice in AW in March and also at Thirsk (1m6f, good to soft) in July, the latter by a short head on five-runner race; not disgraced on latest start; there's a lot more to prove beyond 1m6f, though.

column19: Cavern Club looks sure to go well again but GOOD SHOW, It's All About You and Give It To Me Oj are interesting opponents.

column37: Unraced here; sole win (14 races) came in four-runner 11.6f race at Bath last June for Richard Hughes; no great shakes over hurdles for Harry Derham and yet to recapture his form on Flat after three runs for this yard.

column19: Cavern Club looks sure to go well again but GOOD SHOW, It's All About You and Give It To Me Oj are interesting opponents.

column36: Second of four on his handicap debut (1m4f) but tailed off ten days later (1m6f)
column37: Gelded before his second of four in first-time cheekpieces (retained) on handicap debut at Newmarket (1m4f, good to firm) in July and that's his best form, but tailed off when making most at Yarmouth (1m6f, good to soft) ten days later; others look more solid.

column19: Cavern Club looks sure to go well again but GOOD SHOW, It's All About You and Give It To Me Oj are interesting opponents.

column36: No impact in his four runs for current yard - over 7f twice, then 5f and hooded over 1m4f
column37: 7f win for Joseph O'Brien last autumn and comparable form at 1m; no impact in his four runs for current yard (over 7f twice, then 5f and hooded over 1m4f) and now he tries another new trip.

column37: Made it 16th time lucky when leading towards the finish over 7f here (AW) 18 days ago; below par on both previous outings over 1m and doesn't have the obvious profile of one likely to follow up.

column37: Four wins over 6f/7f in Ireland, including Dundalk's Polytrack; runner-up twice in Britain for  Michael Bell this year but below par on last three starts and changed hands for 1,200gns since the latest 27 days ago.

column37: 0-18 under both codes but latest 7f Yarmouth classified stakes third suggests she still has it in her to be competitive from her basement mark.

column37: Dam 2-3 over 5f on AW; 25-1 for recent C&D debut but she was always prominent before racing clear for a ready win from Loleeta; this will take more winning under a penalty but bold bid still likely.

column37: Close third of five on 5f handicap debut at Wolverhampton (AW) in July but some way below her best  at Chepstow since, where she'd run one of her better races previously; must leave that behind on Polytrack debut.

column37: Similar level of ordinary form in 6f and 5f novices on Polytrack this summer, finishing well behind Arlo's Girl over C&D this month; has a nice pedigree to live up to but handicaps more realistic now.

column37: Has run to a similar level in all three 6f starts and events conspired against her when beaten 1.5l in Q T Pie's race at Windsor on second start; should have a good chance with that one on the revised terms but the drop to 5f is the query.

column37: Has ability but she was left behind by Arlo's Girl when that one was making her debut over C&D 18 days ago; likely to be vulnerable again.

column37: Made an iffy start over fences last year, getting turned over at 1-6 in a match on first attempt, then falling when going okay at Taunton and latterly beaten 16l at Huntingdon; has got back on track over hurdles though and rain won't bother him; 3lb out of the weights.

column37: No longer the force of old but returned from break with C&D (good) win off much reduced mark in June and subsequently ran well over fences here; still well handicapped over hurdles and seems versatile regarding ground; no surprise if he features.

column37: Dual course winner (2m1f/2m2f, good; also effective on soft) this season; perhaps a shade disappointing when beaten in a match race here last time but further progress remains possible, and he helps to give Anthony Honeyball a strong hand in this race.

column37: Made a winning reappearance but holds weak claims on subsequent form; best watched on second run for new yard unless the market speaks positively, which wasn't the case last time.

column36: Form figures read 311; remains open to further improvement; shortlisted
column37: Solid record over 7f at maiden/novice level reads 311, most recently defying a penalty with neck success at Haydock (good to firm) 100 days ago; remains open to further improvement; one for the shortlist.

column37: Seems to handle most ground (won C&D Listed race on soft last year) and turned in best effort when easily beating Bright Thunder to win a Group 3 at Epsom on Derby Day; nothing wrong with that form (Bright Thunder and the fourth won at Listed level next time) and she's a lot better than she showed in a Deauville Group 1 last time; respected despite her 3lb penalty.

column37: No match for Spiritual when second at Epsom in June but bagged a Listed win at Deauville (1m, soft) the following month and posted a career-best RPR when third in Group 3 at Glorious Goodwood (7f, good) 31 days ago; rain no issue for her.

column37: Chelmsford (7f, AW) at the beginning of July on latest outing saw her fill the runner-up spot at Listed level for a second time, but there's more on her plate in this competitive Group 3.

column32: L Boros, R& S Marchant & Partner

column37: Runner-up in German Group 3 (1m, good to soft) last August; wasn't far off that level when 4l seventh of 12 in 1m2f York Listed race five weeks ago but she'll need a big career best to make a significant impact here.

column37: Ended her 3yo campaign with a C&D Listed success on good under Hector Crouch last September; appealed as the sort to kick on again at four but well held in Epsom Group 3 won by Spiritual on reappearance and not seen since.

column37: AW novice winner who was tackling turf for the first time when landing a 1m Chantilly Listed race (good to soft) in May; not disgraced when seventh in Group 1 Prix de Diane over an extended 1m2f back there in June and went down by only a neck in a 1m Ascot Group 3 since, with Cajole behind her in fifth; needs considering.

column37: Smart effort when fourth in the Coronation Stakes at Royal Ascot (1m, good to firm) before filling the runner-up spot at Group 3 level for a second time when going down by 2.5l at Chantilly (1m1f, soft) six weeks ago (final start for Ralph Beckett); her new trainer has been among the winners since taking over at Freemason Lodge; has to enter the reckoning.

column37: Maiden winner here last year who was an excellent second in the 1,000 Guineas at Newmarket (1m, good to firm; acts on good to soft) on seasonal return; failed to back up that effort in the Irish equivalent or the Coronation Stakes but this drop in class could prove liberating back from ten weeks off.

column37: Unraced on softer than good; steady improvement in his four races, leading 1f out for a narrow win on handicap debut at Newbury (1m2f, good to firm; up 6lb today) last time; that was the prestigious London Gold Cup in May and this seems a belated return to action but he has a Group 1 Champion Stakes entry.

column37: Won at Glorious Goodwood (1m2f, good) last July but has not repeated the form and, having left Johnny Murtagh, he was well beaten in the same race on debut for new yard last month; 3lb lower today than that last winning mark.

column37: Usually held up; best known for his three 1m2f wins at Newbury, the last two of which came in the mud and the latest last September off 4lb lower than today; fourth at Yarmouth in July on latest start suggested that he probably retains his ability; not dismissed, with any recent rain probably helping.

column37: Mostly competitive off reduced marks for new yard this season and Haydock (1m2f, good to firm) three weeks ago saw him lead final 1f to break a long losing run, doing it in good style too; back up 5lb but he used to be effective on a range of ground and has returned to serious calculations.

column37: Has built up a solid record (1122) and posted the last two efforts at Listed level; beaten favourite, showing no further progress, at Salisbury (1m) latest but shaped as if this drop back in trip is needed.

column37: One of two once-raced colts in this field; made all and did it easily at Beverley (7.5f, good to firm) where he beat a consistent yardstick by 6l; promising son of the 2018 Solario winner Too Darn Hot.

column37: Thrice-raced colt whose winning form, including in the Chesham (7f, good to firm) at Royal Ascot, has substance; only seventh of ten when 5-1 in a Goodwood Group 2 since but may still do better.

column37: Twice-raced colt who proved game with the hood fitted at Kempton (7f, AW) last time, turning over an odds-on Godolphin runner; may have more to offer in the retained headgear but this is a much stiffer task.

column37: Well-bred colt who stuck on well to beat an odds-on stablemate in Newmarket novice event (7f, good to firm) that has worked out well and has been a source of subsequent Group scorers, including from this yard, in recent years; potentially smart and commands respect.
